div.head: CHAP. XXIX.
1 Dauid exhorteth Princcs to giue glory to God, 3 by reason of his power, 11 and protection of his people.
div.ab: [A Psalme of Dauid.] Giue vnto the Lord (O ye mighty) giue vnto the Lord glory and strength. Hebr. yee sonnes of the mighty.
Giue vnto the Lord the glory due vnto his Name; worship the Lord in the beautie of holinesse. Hebr. the honour of his name. , Or, in his glorious Sanctuary.
The voice of the Lord is vpon the waters: the God of glory thundreth, the Lord is vpon many waters. Or, great waters.
The voice of the Lord is powerfull; the voyce of the Lord is full of Maiestie. Hebr. in power. , Hebr. in Maiestie.
The voyce of the Lord breaketh the Cedars: yea, the Lord breaketh the Cedars of Lebanon.
He maketh them also to skip like a calfe: Lebanon, and Sirion like a yong Unicorne. Deut. 3. 9.
The voyce of the Lord diuideth the flames of fire. Hebr. cutteth out.
The voyce of the Lord shaketh the wildernes: the Lord shaketh the wildernesse of Kadesh. Or, to be in paine.
The voice of the Lord maketh the hindes to calue, and discouereth the forrests: and in his Temple doeth euery one speake of his glory. Or, euery whit of it vttereth &c.
The Lord sitteth vpon the flood: yea the Lord sitteth King for euer.
The Lord will giue strength vnto his people; the Lord will blesse his people with peace.
